DOC.brief_summary: Patients impaired renal function elevate risk development contrast-medium induce acute kidney injury ( CI-AKI ) . CI-AKI associate increase risk cardiovascular morbidity mortality . Effective CI-AKI prevention strategy need . The RenPro-II-WINE Trial design test hypothesis whether moderate red wine consumption prior contrast-medium use effective CI-AKI prevention . Consecutive patient impaired renal function undergo elective coronary angiography assign one four treatment arm : a. control patient receive standard care b. patient receive standard care plus red wine c. patient receive standard care plus white wine d. patient receive standard care plus beer This study give important answer prevent CI-AKI patient impaired renal function undergo contrast medium exposure .
DOC.brief_title: Effect Red Wine , White Wine Beer Contrast-Medium Induced Acute Kidney Injury
DOC.criteria: age > = 18 year impaired renal function ( baseline estimate glomerular filtration rate < 60 ml/min ) least three follow comorbidities : hypertension , diabetes mellitus without insulin therapy , heart failure NYHA III and/or leave ventricular ejection fraction < 35 % , peripheral artery disease , coronary artery disease know alcohol addiction severe renal impairment ( estimate glomerular filtration rate < 15 ml/min and/or chronic dialysis program Recent ( < =30 day ) contrast medium exposure insulin therapy Patients enrol concomitant study fertile woman
